mods:mods.mods:note: Ban Vinai, at 400 acres and a capacity of 50,000 people, was one of the largest centers for the Hmong and other highlander refugees. Located in a valley among hills close to the Lao border, it was closed in 1992. This picture was taken for relatives in Fresno, California, who had sent letters and money with photographer

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Brigitte Marshall collection on Southeast Asian refugees

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Mien baby with big sister - Chiang Kham camp

mods:mods.mods:note: Chian Kham camp in northwestern Thailand was much smaller than Ban Vinai where Hmong and other Lao highlanders were detained if their post 1983 arrival date made them ineligible for resettlement
